dialogues.Raymond: [1] 	He wears an apron, protective glasses and a lopsided sneer. A 	Richard Widmark motherfucker - with the diamond hard look of a 	cobra. The liegelord of downtown...  	And now he works the a hand saw, making critical cross-cuts on a 	wide panel of maple ... Atley Jackson is here as well ... As noisy 	as it is out in the yard, in here, once the door is closed, it's 	as SILENT-as a tomb...  	A BANK OF MONITORS on one wall show the cars being crushed and 	disassembled in the yard. Memphis is led into the room.  	Calitri nods and Dog-face leaves the room... Calitri smiles ... 	Examines his fresh cut...
dialogues.Calitri:
[1] 	He wears an apron, protective glasses and a lopsided sneer. A 	Richard Widmark motherfucker - with the diamond hard look of a 	cobra. The liegelord of downtown...  	And now he works the a hand saw, making critical cross-cuts on a 	wide panel of maple ... Atley Jackson is here as well ... As noisy 	as it is out in the yard, in here, once the door is closed, it's 	as SILENT-as a tomb...  	A BANK OF MONITORS on one wall show the cars being crushed and 	disassembled in the yard. Memphis is led into the room.  	Calitri nods and Dog-face leaves the room... Calitri smiles ... 	Examines his fresh cut...  
[2]		Randall Raines ... It's been a long time ... 			 			frowns 		'though I do I recall you as a man 		with style. You remember your old 		friend, Atley -- ?  
[3]		So. What do we owe the honor -- ?  
[4]		Yes ... Kip ...  	He says the name like other men say "cancer." The phone on 	his desk BLINKS. Calitri picks it up. Listens. Looks at 	one of the monitors. Where the Mexican man is talking to 	several Calitri EMPLOYEES. Calitri hangs up...  
[5]		Excuse me one moment, Randall ...  	And he picks up a MORTISE CHISEL on his way out. Palming it ...  
[6]		You bring this to me in this 		condition? Blood and guts all 		over it? You make me complicit? 		On my property? Who taught you 		how to think? And worst of all: 		weren't there supposed to be two 		Hondas?  
[7]		Stupid sonuvabitch...  
[8] 	Memphis can-see this from one of the monitors. He looks at 	Atley...  
[9]		Now. Where were we? Oh, yes. Kip.  
[10]		I'm proud of this work. The bird 		feeder. The wagon wheel planter. 		The dollhouse. The drop-leaf movable 		server...  	He gestures to each item - exquisitely-rendered woodwork. Then 	gestures to the yard...  
[11]		Metal. Steel. It's cold. Ugly. Wood 		is warm. Clean. Provided by nature. 		To see a piece of furniture take shape. 		It's like watching a child grow ...  	Memphis glances to Atley... Atley shrugs ...  
[12]		My point. Yes. Simple, really. I require 		the best. I insist on the best. I only 		engage the best.  Your brother. His 		friends. They came to me. They wanted my 		paper. He was your brother. You were the 		best. Now. They've brought so much 		goddamn heat down, I may not be able to 		fill this order. Which would be very bad 		for me. Which in turn, is very bad for 		them...  
[13]		Grow up. You don't kill people like me. 		People like me die in their sleep at 		87 ... Do you know why? Because if 		you did kill me, and everyone knew it 		was you - for the next ten years they'd 		be finding pieces of those you love 		scattered all over California ...  	Memphis nods, notes a PISTOL, resting on a shelf nearby.  
[14]		No, no. You don't kill me, because 		you can't. You don't take your brother 		and run, because we'd find him. You 		don't go to the-police, because we have 		friends there, too. You do nothing: 		except deal with me.  	Memphis eyes him...  
[15]		Were it only that easy. I have 		obligations. The order needs to be 		filled...  	Calitri takes a manila ENVELOPE from his desk... Hands it to 	Memphis, who takes out the SINGLE SHEET OF PAPER inside.  
[16]		On that list, you'll find fifty cars. 		Fifty. Five-zero. They range in 		age from the 1956 Ford Thunderbird 		to the 1999 Toyota Camry; and in 		expense from the 1993 Volkswagen 		Jetta to the 1988 Lamborghini 		Countach. Fifty cars. Five-zero.  	Memphis scans the list ... Looks up at Calitri ...  
[17]		There is a container ship in Long 		Beach Harbor. Pier 14. Ready to be 		loaded with 4-car-per shipping 		containers, false-walled and 		customsprofiled as motor oil 		designated. The ship leaves in four 		days for South America and the 		men who've tendered me this contract ...  
[18]		They gave me two weeks. I wasted most of it 		with your brother and his crew, who not 		only lost what pitiful few they managed 		to boost, but also alerted the heat as to our 		endeavor, making this even more difficult 		to achieve ...  	Memphis scans the list ...  
[19]		Four days. 50 cars. I'm paying 200 		thousand dollars ...  	Now Memphis looks up...  
[20]		I knew you'd say that.  
[21]		I knew you'd say that, too --  	Calitri smiles ... Memphis 'looks at him... At Atley Realizing 	the trap ...  
[22]		Your brother has four days. Fifty 		cars. Five-zero. For that he gets 		200 large ...  
[23]		I made this, too. My first one. 		Brass extension handles, not plated. 		The coverings are silk, not rayon. 		Expensive hardwood. And lined with 		spray green Lorraine crepe ...  	Memphis waits, knowing where this is going --  
[24]		Yes, yes. I made it for young Kip. In 		case he fails. At 8:00 Friday morning, 		if that ship sets off without my 		fifty ... Kip will take up permanent 		residence in this box ...  	Calitri WALL SWITCH and the a corrugated steel SLIDING DOOR is 	RAISED, revealing a LOADING DOCK facing the back of the yard... Two 	MEN are working out there... DIGGER AND BUTZ scuzzy dudes, mid-30s 	and dressed in dirty coveralls ...  
[25]		Come here for a second, boys --  	And they come over --  
[26]		Digger, Butz: let me introduce 		you to Randall Raines. Used to 		head up the dandiest ring in 		Southern Cal. Left us 		for parts unknown. Randall, this 		is Digger. And that's Butz -  
[27]		Digger and Butz will be in charge of burial. 		They're good boys ...  	Memphis' look is cold and furious ... Plaintive:  
[28]		"don't want" the Dodgers to lose or 		the summer to end. But we 		don't get to choose these things...  	Atley hits the wall-switch and the steel door slides shut. Calitri 	turns to Memphis...  
[29]		"Nothing that's forced can ever be 		right." Old woodworking expression. 		I really don't care how the 50 		get onto my ship ... I just care 		that they do. You decide.  	With that, he puts his protective glasses back on - and fires up 	an abrasive-disc-finishing machine, adjusting the miter gage and 	beginning to sand the Outside curve of an angled chamfer.  
[30]		Hello, Kip --  	Kip tries to get out. The doors are pinned by the forklift.  
[31]		Were it only that easy --  
[32]		No you can't. Flies on sherbert is what you 		remind me of. Because just being attracted 		to something, doesn't mean you belong...  
[33] 	Atley is here, watching Calitri and Kip. one of the monitors. He's 	miserable. But there is nothing he can do.  
[34]		Call me "Ray." Better yet: call me 		"asshole." Cos that's how you've 		treated me --  
[35]		This is how you're spending my time? 		Having a sock hop?  
[36]		Look at this. A multi-generational gathering 		of scumbags ...  
[37]		Hello, Otto. My boys at the dock report no 		cars have yet to be delivered. And there's 		only one more night ...  
[38]		With all the free time I've had not 		counting cars as they're loaded onto 		my ship, I've managed to sand the 		cedar inside your box, Kip. This 		will protect you from the anaerobic 		bacteria, that normally thrives in 		an airless; environment. Thus 		prolonging decay ...  	He smiles ... And Kip actually makes a run for him... Only to be 	held back by Tumbler and Donny ...  
[39]		One more night --  
[40]		I hope you know what you're doing. God help 		you if you don't ...  	And with that, he leaves, his goons following. Leaving our  	crew to stare after him ... And then we FADE TO BLACK...  	As a SUPER on-screen reads PART III: SWITCHIN'-TO-GLIDE  
[41]		Well, well. You've caused quite a ruckus ...  
[42]		Right there -  	He gestures to a Haliburton case ... Memphis opens it ... There's 	a lot of cash inside...  
[43]		200 K. Just like we said ...  
[44]		But I had to. It was the only way to 		get to you --  	Memphis looks at him... Calitri smiles ...  
[45]		I don't know about that, Randall. 		He did such a good job on this paper. 		And another one just came in ...  	Calitri goes to the FAX machine... Tears off the sheet..  
[46]		It's an easier take. 30 cars. Two 		weeks. Most of them SUVs. Going to 		Russia. Think Kip'll be interested?  
[47]		Well, that certainly won't do.  
[48]		Look at it. I can't very well make 		delivery of that thing ...  
[49]		Fifty cars. Fifty cars by 8 AM 		Friday. Or Kip goes in that box. 		That was the deal ... Goddamn, it ... 		That was the deal ...  	Memphis is by a TABLE SAW... He flicks it on. The electric MOTOR 	rumbles, so as to obfuscate, any noise in here ...  
[50]		What are you doing -- ?  
[51] 	Memphis walks to the battered Eleanor ... As Pearl Jam's 	"Rearviewmirror' crunches and a CAR comes motoring up to him. It's 	ANOTHER 167 SHELBY. ANOTHER ELEANOR, a "For Sale" sign pasted on 	the back window. It's being driven by Kip...
dialogues.Donny:
[1]		Problem, Officer?  
[2]		For running a stop sign?  
[3]		Pull over! Pull her the hell over!  	Jenny pulls the car over in a lopsided lurch...  
[4]		Put it in PARK. Remember how 		to do that? It's the big "Pff.  	She parks it. He stabs at the side-view mirror ...  
[5]		"Objects May Appear Closer 		Than They Seem." Can you say 		that for me?  
[6]		You ain't sorry. You're a horrible 		driver... You can't strap into 		your seat belt, without almost 		getting creamed by a bus ...  	She starts to cry... Donny softens ...  
[7]		Aw, c'mon. It's no big deal. 		You can't drive. You can't. 		Time to acknowledge it and move on. I 		can't swim. I know I can't. So you 		know what I do? I stay the fuck outta 		the pool ...  
[8]		Damn. Memphis Raines. Long time ...  
[9]		All I get are the Orientals. They can 		build 'em, but they can't drive 		'em So? What are you doing here? 		What's with the outfit -- ?  
[10]		Most of 'em are gone. The Dyar Boys are 		doing a nickel at Chino; Henry Santoro 		and Frankie Fish are moving 		weight in Florida; Bill Doolin was 		killed in Denver... Atley 		Jackson's on the gimp and runnin' 		errands for Calitri; The Sphinx 		is still around, I guess ... Then 		of course, there's ...  	His pause is meaningful ...  
[11]		Okay. Figure it forgotten. What's this 		about anyways -- ?  
[12]		Most of 'em are late-model...  
[13]		We'll have to start beating the 		bushes, find out where they live...  	Otto enters. Giggles...  
[14]		A bunch of strung-out hypes and stick- 		up men. This ain't like the old days, 		Memphis. The profession has lost its..  
[15]		Yeah...  
[16]		Wow! They got Eleanor here -- ?  
[17]		Lookit Kip. All grown up...  
[18]		You guys have any skills at all?  
[19]			 		What about him?  
[20]		There's no one left ...  
[21]			 		We sent him out on a solo boost. See 		what he could do ...  	Freb pulls in an '89 Cadillac Coupe De Ville ...  
[22]		How'd it go?  
[23]		Well, that defies the point, don't it?  
[24]		Get the damn thing in there and get it 		cleaned up -  	Freb pulls in. Pops the trunk. The gate is closed.  
[25]		Lemme see that -  	He pierces the skin.. Tastes ...  
[26]		Heroin.  
[27]		There's gotta be a million bucks worth 		here -  
[28]		Jesus. The whole damn thing's loaded.  
[29]		Car-jacking is the lazy man's boost. 		No skill. No finesse. Can only take 		the car if the key is in it. That's 		not thieving. That's parking ... 		Thugs ... With the decency of dirt ...  
[30]		Eleanor is Memphis' "unicorn."  
[31]		Grade-A unicorn ...  
[32]		Fabled creature. You know - the horse 		with the horn? Impossible to capture?  	Toby looks blank ...  
[33]		We all got one. The single car 		that, no matter how many times 		you try to boost, something happens... 		Cops show up, car doesn't start, owner 		comes back. It's voodoo...  
[34]		You'll get the hang of it, kid. You 		just need to remember one thing -  
[35]		On boost night? Always take along a 		good mix tape ...  	Donny smiles ... Freb frowns ...  
[36]		You bring a woman back to your 		crib for some lovemaking, the 		song you put on, depends on the 		woman, the type of lovemaking you 		intend to do, right?  
[37]		You got a school teacher or Nancy from 		accounting, you don't put on Sly Stone 		or James Brown. You put on 		Ravel. Rachmaninoff. But if you got 		some wild one you just picked 		up at the track, you wouldn't put on 		Cat Stevens or James Taylor. 		You'd put on Prince. Or Isaac Hayes. 		Or, if you really wanted to 		get after it: Miles.  
[38]		It's the same way with cars. Different 		cars. Different tunes. You can't steal 		a Maserati listening to Sinatra. You 		gotta get urgent. You gotta get Sonny 		Rollins or Led Zeppelin IV, on that 		shit. But never, never-ever take no Allman 		Brothers into a Lincoln Town Car. Could 		lead to disaster. Got it... ?  
[39]		Good.  	And then Sway enters ... Donny gets out of the Caddy ...  
[40]		Whoa, whoa, whoa. Memphis went out 		and got some big game ... Hello, Sway. 		I was just telling the lads about mix 		tapes --  
[41]		Gender bias ...  	Otto is before her ... Bowing from the waist ...  
[42]		What do you think about all this?  
[43]		That's my girl --  
[44]		Well, well, well. The original crash 		test dummy...  	The Sphinx nods to all. Smiles warmly, but it comes out creepy. 	Freb whispers to Otto ...  
[45]		It's arright ...  	They drive on ... Till --  
[46]		Check it out: 173 Firebird. Know 		who drove one of those ... ?  
[47]		That's being obscurest ... Who else? 		Better known. Memphis?  
[48]		For real. Okay. Gimme COLUMBO...  
[49]		What color?  
[50]		You ever notice how it had a different 		interior every week? That bugged me.  
[51]		I'd like the names and addresses of 		the owners of these 20 cars please...  
[52]		I can wait.  	He smiles kindly at her. And takes a seat. It's that easy.  
[53]		Thomas Sullivan Magnum, to be exact.  	They look at Donny, impressed...  
[54]		Jonathan Quayle Higgins ...  
[55]		Walked like a bastard... Skippin' 		stones and shit..  
[56]		I think so too --  	And they drive... All smiles ... All pleased with 	themselves ... And, after a beat ...  
[57]		What are you doing?  
[58]		The hell are you doing?  
[59]		Big deal. Now what?  
[60]		I miss Orville Redenbacher already --  
[61]		Very good. Think you can get in without 		waking her up -- ?  
[62]		That's an after-market alarm. Can't 		just cut her wires ...  	He pops his briefcase ... Takes out some gear ... Gets out ... 	Moves for Diane 1 ...  
[63]		What's the matter?  
[64]		Yeah?  	He holds up a screwdriver. Jams it in the steering column.  
[65]		I don't care what kind of car 		it is. How fancy; how expensive; 		how new. You pop the collar - 		it's 1966 all over again ... !  	He pops the collar - exposing an ordinary ignition system.  
[66]		So? Tell me: how come they call you 		"Freb" anyways -- ?  
[67]		We're partners here --  	Freb considers ... Then, reluctantly --  
[68]		Glad to know you, "Freberick." Let's 		roll -  	And off they go ...  
[69]		Of course not. I'm Robin Hood. I take 		from the rich, and give to the needy...  
[70]		No. The needy. Us. Cos we need this 		car!  	And Donny puts her in gear, When a GUN is jammed agains't Donny's 	temple ...  
[71]		Are you kidding me -- ?  
[72]		I'm stealing this car. So BACK OFF!  
[73]		Donny-nothin'!  	And he SLAMS OPEN THE DOOR... catching the kid in the balls ... 	And the kid doubles over... Dropping the gun ... Donny gets out of 	the car...  
[74]		Lazy, disrespectinIf half-assed 		bully. Any asshole can pull a gun ...  	And he starts to kick at the kid ... Beat at him...  
[75]		You don't know how to steal a 		car, do ya? So you gotta take 		them when there's already a key 		in them ... And a person in them... 		Scare people ... Intimidate ... 		Little freakin' bully ...  
[76]		Lazy ... Lazy ... I ask you, Freb: 		what's the matter with kids today?  	But then - BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! Bullets rip into Donny Astricky in 	terrifying SLOW-MOTION. He turns ... To see another KID ... 	Scared... At the edge of the road... Gat held high ... And Donny 	drops to the pavement ... And the first Jacker gets to his feet...  	Freb goes to Donny... To his splayed-out body ... SIRENS split the 	night. The jackers run off down the street.  
[77]		Get outta here. Get out. Now!  
[78]		I'm all right. Been shot before. You 		take me to the hospital, they bust the 		both of us. The cops'll take me. Go!  	And Freb-makes to run off down the street... But --  
[79]		Freb -- !  	Freb turns back  
[80]		Take Laura with you, you stupid shit!  	Freb blinks. Nods. Oh, yeah. He climbs into the Bentley Drives off... 	As the CRUISERS pull up around him... And the UNIFORMS getout, guns 	drawn, approaching warily -  	To find Donny Astricky ... Splayed-out on the pavement ... 	Laughing at the moon ... And, as Jimi Hendrix' "Crosstown Traffic" 	BLASTS ON TRACK, we CUT TO:  	of the final series of boosts ...  	1) The Maserati parked and empty. Sway breaches it. 	Expert. They drive off ...  	2) Kip and Tumbler. Clocking a VIPER. They circle it.. 	It's loaded with bells and whistles and Clubs and a 	metallic voice that warns: "WARNING: YOU ARE TOO CLOSE THE 	VEHICLE!" over and over ... Kip shakes his head ... 	Ushers Tumbler back ...  	3) Mirror Man and The Sphinx deliver an Aston Martin to the docks 	... Watch as it is driven into a container. The container loaded 	by gantry crane, onto the ship, lashed to the deck by overworked
